pages.text: $(item)Infused Iron$() is good and well, and it has enough natural power to do a variety of things on its own. But for more advanced mechanisms, a more powerful metal is required. For that, and for a lot of other things, the $(item)Offering to the Gods$() is required.$(br)The Gods have been, for a long time, the strongest and most powerful beings, and as such, also posess the strongest metals known to man.

To construct a way to call to the Gods themselves, simply place down an $(item)Offering Table$() with some flowers around it as depicted on the next page. Then, to start an offering, place any amount of items you want to offer into the bowl on the table, and then throw down the item that will call the Gods themselves, in most cases, the $(item)Spirit of Calling$(), close to the table.$(br)The requested items will then, with any luck, rain down from the sky.
Preparing the $(item)Offering to the Gods$(). Any type of flower can be used.
Asking for $(item)Ingots of the Sky$(), a powerful metal infused with divine energy.
Asking for $(item)Ingots of the Sky$() using $(item)Tainted Gold$() results in a higher yield.
Exchanging the $(item)Token of Joy$() for a much stronger version, the $(item)Token of Euphoria$()
Exchanging the $(item)Token of Fear$() for a much stronger version, the $(item)Token of Terror$()
Exchanging the $(item)Token of Anger$() for a much stronger version, the $(item)Token of Rage$()
Exchanging the $(item)Token of Sorrow$() for a much stronger version, the $(item)Token of Grief$()
